oai_dc:dc.dc:title: General Orders, No. 296
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: U. S. Army order to create a national cemetery commemorating the Battles of Chattanooga, fought November 23-27, 1863, and "to provide a proper resting place for the remains of the brave men who fell upon the fields." Materials to build a monument; were to be easily available in the vicinity. The order was issued by command of Maj. Gen. George H. Thomas, Commander, Army of the Cumberland, USA, and it solicits designs for such a memorial.
